translation: rekonwalescencja [the period of time when you rest and get better after a serious illness]
sentence: You need four to six weeks' convalescence.

translation: sprawa do załatwienia [a short journey either to take a message or to take or collect something]
sentence: I'll meet you at six, I've got some errands to run first.

translation: ekshumować [formal; to remove a dead body from the ground after it has been buried]
sentence: The body was exhumed on the order of the judge.

translation: haniebny [formal; (esp. of a crime) extremely bad or evil]
sentence: In the enlightened 18th century popular fanaticism made of sacrilege the most heinous offence.

translation: naruszenie, pogwałcenie prawa [formal; an occasion when someone breaks a rule or law]
sentence: Any attempt to influence the judges will be seen as an infraction of the rules.

translation: środek [formal; the middle of a group of people or things]
sentence: Such beauty was unexpected in the midst of the city.

translation: półmisek, taca [a large plate used for serving food or a meal with one type of food served on a large plate]
sentence: I cut the apples into pieces and put them on a platter.

translation: stóg, sterta [a large pile of straw or hay that has been built in a regular shape]
sentence: In summer months the siren can be heard almost daily as hay barns and hay ricks catch fire.

translation: lipa, fałszywka, oszust [something that is not what it seems to be and is intended to deceive people, or someone who pretends to be something they are not]
sentence: It turned out that he wasn't a real doctor at all - he was just a sham.

translation: wyniosły, lekceważący [disapproving; behaving as if you are better than other people, and that their opinions, beliefs, or ideas are not important]
sentence: He spoke in a haughty, supercilious voice.
